Question 58) Human skin, when well hydrated, acquires good elasticity and soft and smooth appearance. On the other hand, when dry, it loses its elasticity and is opaque and rough. To avoid dryness of the skin, it is necessary, whenever possible, to use moisturizing moisturizers, usually made of glycerin and polyethylene glycol: polyethylene glycol glycerin, water surface retention promoted by moisturizers is a consequence of the interaction of hydroxyl groups of moisturizing agents with the humidity contained in the environment through
A) Ionic bonds.
B) London forces.
C) covalent bonds.
D) Dipolo-Dipole forces.
E) hydrogen bonds.
